Orion thought he found the woman for him until he met Frankie. Now torn between two women, how would he be able to decide?

Frankie was a single mom who was trying to do the best for her son. She definitely wasn’t looking for love but somehow it found her. Only problem was if he finds out who she really was, would he still want her?

I have been waiting for Orion’s story and it was even better than I imagined it could be! This was my favorite of the series, it was just everything!! I loved how everything fell into place and how much it was meant to be. I did not want to say goodbye to these guys at all!!

history: 030746542X 1089382561 1086605233 1706091559 1672457521 B08DBVR236 1950884112 B08W7SQ86D B08WJPN2FT B08XYFP2J8 B092P78MTH 0399590315 B08N1JMLVW B09CRQNSH7 B09DMTLV4H B09FS9S7FQ B09GXK16JD B09GZDW3ZR B09M54VP9N B09MX98W1Y 1949975363 B09NN55PX2 B09R3DJ9S9 B09SNMYCFB B09TDW84YQ B09VGSCXHD B09VVVTHZF
review:
Gah! Prepare Yourself!: Whhhyyyy??? My heart was not happy…Tight Laced was another amazing installment in Lisa’s Vegas Aces: The Tight End Series. They must be read in order. It was sweet, sexy, and left me on the edge of my seat!

Kaylee and Ben were at a point where feelings could no longer be ignored but what would that mean for their future? They both wanted different things and neither one of them wanted to budge. To be together one of them would have to give in but would that cause problems down the line? Or would it even matter once they saw the bigger picture?

Holy emotional roller coaster ride. I loved how much more these two connected, it gave me all the warm fuzzies and then bam…cliffhanger!!! I know there would be one but nope, I still don’t like it. Book five can’t get here fast enough!!

history: 030746542X 1089382561 1086605233 1706091559 1672457521 B08DBVR236 1950884112 B08W7SQ86D B08WJPN2FT B08XYFP2J8 B092P78MTH 0399590315 B08N1JMLVW B09CRQNSH7 B09DMTLV4H B09FS9S7FQ B09GXK16JD B09GZDW3ZR B09M54VP9N B09MX98W1Y 1949975363 B09NN55PX2 B09R3DJ9S9 B09SNMYCFB B09TDW84YQ B09VGSCXHD B09VVVTHZF B09WHFGH9K
review:
So Good!!!!: Talk about absolute swoon! The world definitely needs more Eastons! A Chance Encounter was the latest and greatest by Nikki Ash. It was sweet, sexy, and pure perfection!

Sophia had become a mother at a young age but she was determined to do everything in her power to show her daughter unconditional love. That left little time for herself but she wouldn’t have it any other way. So when she met a handsome stranger who sparked something she thought was long gone, would she hold onto it or would she walk away?

Easton knew the moment he met Sophia there was something between them. Unfortunately he didn’t get the chance to explore it since she vanished without a trace. Luck was on his side though, he found out she was looking for him. But would what she had to tell him scare him off for good or would he fight for what was his?

So sweet!! The emotions just poured off the pages. If you want a book full of love that will have you smiling and swooning, this is the book for you!! And the epilogue…gah!! Absolutely amazing!!

history: 030746542X 1089382561 1086605233 1706091559 1672457521 B08DBVR236 1950884112 B08W7SQ86D B08WJPN2FT B08XYFP2J8 B092P78MTH 0399590315 B08N1JMLVW B09CRQNSH7 B09DMTLV4H B09FS9S7FQ B09GXK16JD B09GZDW3ZR B09M54VP9N B09MX98W1Y 1949975363 B09NN55PX2 B09R3DJ9S9 B09SNMYCFB B09TDW84YQ B09VGSCXHD B09VVVTHZF B09WHFGH9K B09WQ4SB1B
review:
ALL the emotions!! ❤️: All the emotions!! Controlled Chaos was the first book in Nikki’s Love and Lyrics series. It was full of angst, sweet moments, and lots of love!

Camden had missed his chance to tell Layla how he felt about her. She moved on with another man while he moved on with his band. Five years later she moved back home but it wasn’t just her anymore. Could Camden figure out how fit in with her new life or would he miss his second chance?

Oh my heart! I have been looking forward to this series and Nikki definitely delivered! Camden and Layla were so perfect, I loved seeing their struggles that made the ending that much better! I can’t wait to see what else Nikki has in store for us!!

Side note - Nikki warned about some triggers, if you are one that could possibly be affected check her website out first. I didn’t think anything of them but it takes a lot for me.

Such an emotional ride: This book comes with a trigger warning and oh, boy! Did I needed time to process that prologue 😱 after I recovered from the initial shock, I devoured this book! The angst was real! Ryder and Zeta’s story is not one for the faint of heart! It’s a heart breaking, soul wrenching story between two beautiful, troubled souls.

I highlighted so many pages, everything that needed to be said was said! Everything! Siobhan has a way with words, every single interaction between Ryder and Zeta was exactly what what’s needed at the moment.

This is the first book I read by Siobhan and I have become obsessed! No other book has ever taken me through so many different emotions. It’s a beautiful piece of art, I cannot describe it any other way.
Please do yourself a favor and grab a box of tissues, a bottle of water and get ready for one of the best emotional rides of your life through a book! It’s so worth it!
Needless to say this a five star book for me.

Decker and Maggie, written in the stars: This is the story of officer Cole Decker and Maggie O’Brien.
They were best friends during high school and although they had feelings for each other they were never able to express them. She ends up having a bad night with another guy and becomes pregnant at 17. Her life changed completely and Cole and Maggie grew apart. Fast forward 14 years and he’s an outstanding police officer and she’s the town’s flower shop owner and the mom of a sweet and rebellious girl.
Over the years Maggie and Cole (or Decker like everyone calls him) not only grew apart, they became enemies. He did everything he could to make her life miserable, you’d think that a man in his 30s would behave better but no, he goes out of his way to make her feel bad, when deep down he loves her so much it hurts, and this is the way he came up to keep her away from him since he blames himself for things that end up making her life harder than it needed to be.
Maggie on the other hand is clueless to how Decker feels about her and although deep down she knows she loves him, she cannot get past the fact that he treats her so bad. Until one faithful night, when Maggie is in danger, Decker is there to help! Would they be able to let go of their guilt over their past and get a HEA?

This is my first Chikalu Falls book and I’m in love!!!
Small town, fun group of friends, hotter than hot hero and strong heroine? Yes, please! I love everything about this story. How the dynamics between Maggie and Decker evolve and how deeply they care about each other. And their steam? Well, is pretty, pretty hot! He’s bossy! And she loves it 😈
I also love the connection between Decker and Lottie (Maggie’s daughter). I give this book 5 stars and highly recommend it! Now I can’t wait to have some free time and read the other two books in the series 💜

Best book ever: This is book 5 in the Mason Family series but it can be read as a stand-alone. Wade Mason is a very successful architect, he’s the perfect embodiment of smart and handsome. The third out of five brothers, he’s the middle child to a T. Always trying to blend in. He’s logical, rational and shows as little emotions as possible.
When his family company catches the attention of an Uber millionaire guy to design and build a house, Wade is forced to work with the guy’s granddaughter, Dara. And his life changes forever.
Where Wade is grumpy, Dara is sunshine. He’s a rule follower, she’s impulsive and relaxed. They complement each other perfectly and bring the best out on each other. He’s been guarded for so long, will Wade open up and find his HEA?

This book is absolutely amazing, so many things get resolved! It brought me full circle not only with the Mason family but also brought in some beloved characters from other Adriana’s books.
I don’t want to spoil the book for anyone but I do have to share that my favorite part was to see Wade smile, he’s always been so guarded that when he finally felt comfortable with Dara to be himself and we so more and more of the amazing man he is, my heart burst with joy and I teared up. Wade Mason, you are amazing, you finally found your way to love and I was so happy to see you be complete again. Dara with her bubbly personality was finally able to bring Wade out of his armor.

What an amazing, emotional ride! I’m in love!: When I started reading this book I really didn’t know what to expect other than the story of a pop star, grumpy hero and a sunshine heroine who had a simple life.
My, oh my! The earthquake not only changed RJ and Dani’s lives (having to make a life changing decision with only seconds to spare), it gave me an amazing, emotional ride!!!
It was absolutely amazing to see all the emotions these pair went through while under piles and piles of concrete after enduring a 7.1 earthquake (rage, fear, envy, love, lust, acceptance, peace). Their bond is not only one made by love, it’s forged by extreme circumstances that make you or brake you and these two like a Phoenix were rebirthed under the earths’ core.

This story ended up being a forced slow burn romance and I’m in love! RJ and Dani are real and endured so much growing up, they deserved the gale force wind and the hot rockstar ✨

Alesso is what dreams are made of: Siobhan’s stories always hit the ground running. Alesso and Serena hit it off before something real can happen between them but who can blame a woman that has endured so much? Serena’s not only a survivor, she’s a fighter. She’s one amazing woman and this story shows how strong and smart she really is.
Alesso is the most beautiful, loving and caring alpha I’ve ever read. Even more amazing is the fact that he’s a mafia guy, yet he wears his feelings in his sleeves, for everyone to see. Making him more awesome and powerful in my eyes.

I really enjoyed this book, it’s plenty dark with the sweetest amount of sunshine and happiness to deliver a beautiful HEA.

Suspense and very hot MC novel. Loved it!: Ethan Packwood (Legend) is part of the Cerberus MC and has a crush on Faith Robbins, an attorney that has helped the club’s members in the past. Faith doesn’t do relationships and she definitely doesn’t mix her personal and professional lives so she decides to push Legend away (despite finding him attractive) and she’s not nice about it. After rejecting Legend several times she feels bad for the way she did it and offers an apology. Fast forward couple of weeks and they’re at the town’s bar when someone tries to take advantage of Faith and their lives change forever.

I’m so happy I decided to read Legend’s book after reading “A Avery Cerberus Christmas”. This MC world is amazing and I love how tight this group is.

The chemistry between Ethan and Faith is undeniable, even though these two are stubborn! Ethan is such an amazing hero, once he’s all in he gives everything that he is. Faith does a lot of work to do to catch up but once she does, fireworks are in order!
I loved the suspense that kept me turning the pages and how strong the characters are! Another great book in this amazing MC world.

Such a heartwarming story!: Cassidy and Marco have know each other for a while given that he’s her bodyguard (the brother is a big shot country star). Cassidy is a single mom and owns a restaurant so needless to say she doesn’t have much time left for anything else, EXCEPT she works out with Marco every night 😉(she has hypotonia due to a genetic condition). Marco is a former military man, who’s main focus is work and helping Cassidy (yeah, he’s crushing hard 😉).
Anyways, this pair is always thinking they don’t deserve the each other, that they’re not worthy. She thinks she’s an obligation, a responsibility to him. He thinks he’s not good enough for her. Frustrating it’s an understatement BUT it makes up for one amazing ride!
I absolutely loved this friends to lovers romance. They both are so strong and trustworthy, I absolutely loved their connection! Their love is easy, I hope it makes sense. The way they support each other is goals!!
I also love the connection with music, there’s a song for each chapter and it definitely helps set the mood. Love, love, love!

history: B09K2G3V27 B09M992S38 B09MYYXGYK 1949975363 B09NRZL25Z B09NRDMK8N B09PM8BL27
review:
Loved their connection!: This is the story of Posey Greene abs Gavin Price.
Posey owns a hair salon, Fringe. She’s in her mid twenties and as a teenager had a major crush on Gavin Price, an actor that recently decided to make Sunrise Bay, Alaska his home. They’ve know each other for a while since his best friend married one of Posey’s sisters. He finally gets the guts to ask her out on a date, the best date they both have had! Until he learns her mom is running for major and so is he 😱 will their chemistry be enough to overcome this rivalry and get them a HEA?
OMG Gavin is as swoony and sweet as they come, I’m in love with Gavin 😅 Posey is feisty and overprotective of her mom, so what started as a beautiful blooming love ended up being friends to enemies to lovers 😅 their banter is delicious! The way Gavin lays it all out for her 😍😍😍 and please don’t forget how meddling the Greene’s can be, not only the grandmas this time! 🤣🤣🤣 I laughed so hard! What a fantastic rom com. I can’t wait for the next book ❤️

history: B09K2G3V27 B09M992S38 B09MYYXGYK 1949975363 B09NRZL25Z B09NRDMK8N B09PM8BL27 B09QQZDDDK
review:
Love me some sports romance!: This is the story of Rowan Reese and Dee Jones. They both play for Manchester Athletic (mens team and women’s team, respectively). He’s grumpy, ladies man and needs to clean his image. Dee is sunshine personified! They couldn’t be more different, yet they are always looking for each other.
The team management is making great efforts to give more visibility to the women’s team and decides to do some pre-season activities alongside the mens team… ahhhh! OMG! 🤩🤩🤩 I honestly don’t want to give the book away, I just want to say that I loved their banter. It’s a professional competition between these two, no kidding! I loved to see so much talk about the sport (soccer, football 😍), how this should be happening in real life (give more opportunities to the women’s team).
I loved their chemistry! Gahhh two athletes?!? Yes please and THANK YOU! How they become ONE 😍 You all honestly really need to read this book, whether your into soccer or not, this book is amazing! Ms. Dyer does an outstanding job describing the characters and all the places they visit. I honestly felt I was at the stadium 😍
I cannot recommend this book enough!

history: B09K2G3V27 B09M992S38 B09MYYXGYK 1949975363 B09NRZL25Z B09NRDMK8N B09PM8BL27 B09QQZDDDK B09QJ7JY9Y
review:
What an outstanding book!: This is book three in the series and OMG what a finale!!! Kyle James is just a boy who loves to race and that way he helps his mom. His family isn’t perfect and it broke apart when his father passed away. He’s been best friends with Rylie Jackson since Kindergarten, they do everything together, know each other to the core and have made the promise to loose their virginity to each other… the older Kyle gets the farther he drifts away from Rylie, there’s just so much going on behind that sweet boy’s face. After their night together, Kyle vanishes and Rylie is left alone to create her own life, without him.
Until one day he returns but he has become someone dark and larger than life. Will they be able to overcome their obstacles and create a HEA?
OMG, OMG, OMG! This book can be read as a stand-alone but I’ve you’ve been following the series 😱 I thought Juan Hernandez (book 2) had killed me with his hotness and dark ways… I wasn’t prepared for Kyle James to kill me and then put me back together. Kyle might be young but he have lived a thousand lives! This boy is fierce, loyal and behind his Joker facade, good to the core. If there were ever doubts that a hero could be good and bad at the same time, look no further! Kyle James is the answer. This beautiful man loves deeply, loves hard, and there’s nothing more important than Rylie. There will never be nothing more relevant in his life than Rylie! The connection between these two goes beyond any rational comprehension. They are each other’s person and I’m so thankful Ashley wrote their book. It took me on an exhilarating ride full of hate, love, lust and redemption.
Ashley did it again, somehow she was able to top a book that was already on top of the world. Bravo, Ashley! What an outstanding book!

history: B09K2G3V27 B09M992S38 B09MYYXGYK 1949975363 B09NRZL25Z B09NRDMK8N B09PM8BL27 B09QQZDDDK B09QJ7JY9Y 1733791965
review: An interesting read: Katie is 17 and Thomas is 10 years her senior, they meet randomly and there’s an instant connection between. What starts as a meet cute ends up being so much more! Since due to many circumstances Thomas becomes her bodyguard. They are both extremely smart and see life through numbers. She’s innocent and sweet, he’s guarded and has a constant pull between what he wants to do and what he should be doing. Her family has more secrets than they can handle and she finds herself in the eye of the hurricane.

history: B09K2G3V27 B09M992S38 B09MYYXGYK 1949975363 B09NRZL25Z B09NRDMK8N B09PM8BL27 B09QQZDDDK B09QJ7JY9Y 1733791965 1732931437
review:
The finale this series deserved! Outstanding!: When you’ve been friends since kindergarten there’s not much that can pass between you and your best friend without being noticed. So when Penelope Taylor and Beckham Ellingsworth have been distant for over 8 months her meddling family starts to wonder what’s going on. Pen and Beck have been best friends forever and after one life altering kiss, Beck ran to Italy to help with his family’s business. He’s back in the States and moves to NYC to fix his relationship back with Penelope, the question is can they go back to being just friends when that kiss was everything?
I’ve read and loved this entire series, the Taylor brothers are just outstanding so it’s no wonder that the man to catch Penelope Taylor’s heart had to be just as outstanding and amazing as her brothers. Boy oh boy, do I love Beckham! I identified myself with him in more ways than one, not just with his impecable taste in music and tv shows 😉 😉 but in how he sees life after being raised by parents that weren’t really there for him.
Beck and Pen have the connection of two old souls and the chemistry is there to match. I loved every single thing about this book, from the family meddling to sibblings antics, to the girls calling them out on their GD bologni 🤣 Laura and Willow are masters at creating romance with all the feels and all the laughs. Thank you so much ladies!

An outstanding end to the series: Julian Gray, the commander, is looking for a new Secretary for his facade business when Taliyah Wells shows up and he can’t look away!
Julian despite being always in command and thinking before acting, goes head first and fast with Tally. They both have so many secrets, can’t they overcome them and get a HEA?

Last installment in the Men of Hidden Justice and OMG! I don’t know what I was expecting from Julian but dang! Love him! Such an alpha, dirty mouth, hot man! 😅 and Tally is his perfect match, determined but cautious. They get a second chance after failing miserably in an attempt of protecting one another from their secrets. I absolutely loved the twists and turns of this story. It got me grinning and wondering the entire time I was reading it! Another hit by Ms. Moreland. Love, love, love!

Luke is so real and sweet and amazing!: Luke Bryson is the drummer of Sad Fridays, an up and coming rock band from Manchester. They’re in Detroit recording their first album after one of their songs went viral thanks to a post by Willow Walker, an influencer.
Willow goes to meet them in Detroit and her connection with Luke is instantaneous. They have the most epic one night stand and when morning comes, Luke is gone and they carry on with their lives. Or so they think… two months later Willow shows up in Manchester bearing news, she’s pregnant and she needs Luke’s help to save her career. They agree to live together and pretend they’re a couple so she won’t loose sponsors and hence can save her online persona. Will they be able to fake it until they make it?

Oh my! Book 3 in the series and I’m in loveeeeee. Luke said something in the book that resonated with me and I think it sums up their relationship pretty well. Willow stuck with him when he was at his lowest (he was an addict, his life was out of control, spiraling down) and she gets to reap the benefits of his success now that because of her and their baby he wanted to step up his game and dealt with his demons to be the best version of himself he could be. It was amazing to see Luke’s transformation. Amazing! It made me love him so much more to see him owning his mistakes, making mends with friends and family. Mental health is as important as physical health! A strong hero takes care of himself too! Love, love, love it!
Believe or not, Willow is a very strong, independent woman who was just trying to do what she thought it was best for her and her baby. Her parents betrayed her big time and she does everything in her power to claim back what is rightfully hers. I loved seeing the behind the scenes of what’s like being an influencer, all the work that goes creating good content for so many different platforms. And of course I loved seeing Sad Fridays getting ready for their first proper tour! I’d so go to a concert if they were a band in real life! Loved seeing the band rallying up together to protect Luke and Willow. Jase is so in love with Cerys (book 2) and I loved seeing little snippets of the rest of the band mates!
Next will be Alex’s book and I cannot wait because Alex is not your regular type of guy. He’s very open minded and he’ll need an equally open minded partner.

Such an amazing book! In love!: Cooper was a senior at Atterton, working towards his pre-law degree. He needed to finish a paper but there was a storm and only a few places in town still had power. He walked to this little cafe, got a table and started to work. Then he saw her, Story. He had seen her at a party at his place couple months ago. She was stunning, with the brightest smile. Power eventually went out at the cafe too and he didn’t have enough battery left in his computer to finish the paper on time. Story was sweet and kind, she offered her place so he could finish his paper. What started as a simple helping hand ended up being one of the most amazing love stories ever.

Cooper and Story have a strong connection, their love comes easy and they both fall hard. What they weren’t expecting is so many things being thrown at them. To the point they love might not be enough and is better to let go.

Cooper and Story! I love them so! Their love gave me all the feels of that young love, when you feel invincible and larger than life. I loved how strong and protective Cooper is of Story. He stood up for her but it wasn’t enough. Then Story, my oh my. What an amazing, strong heroine. Love how down to earth she is, how determined and brave. These two together! Chef’s kiss ❤️ life is never easy, so I was happy to see that despite everything they were only theirs. There was never anyone else! Their love is pure magic. Love, love, love!

Paige and Nate are amazing: Paige Carmichael works at The Golden Room a bar owned by Nate Hughes, single dad and hotness personified. Paige is 10 years younger, still in college and trying to figure out life. Nate is the best dad ever, so responsible, loving and caring. He knows he has feelings for Paige but he also knows he can’t go there, she’s off limits.
Paige needs a place to crash and Nate being the amazing guy that he is doesn’t hesitate to let her into his home. Will they find their way to forever?

Oh Nate Hughes, you’re not just boyfriend material. You come with the ring and chapel included, you hubby, you! There’s nothing more sexy than a man that knows what he wants and isn’t afraid to lay it all out. The way he talks to Paige and encourages her to be honest and open, EVERYTHING!
Their chemistry is amazing, not only hot but so fun and easy! Real! They fit together perfectly, having tormented pasts gives them a level of understanding that’s hard to come by. They are each other’s rocks and it’s just amazing.

I know this book is not about him, and you can totally read it as a stand-alone BUT Hollis Hudson!!! He’s Paige brother and they just recently reunited. He looked for her for so long and finally found her! HE’S THE MOST AMAZING BIG BROTHER EVER. Their interactions are everything. Thank you, Addy for listening to your fandom and giving us their happy endings 😭❤️

This book is perfection. Love Cade and Scarlett: Caden St. James and Scarlett Kingston.
One night is all she allowed them to have after so many years… one night and then go back to being strangers… except the condom broke and she ended up getting pregnant. She’s the VP and PR relations manager of her family’s empire, she’s a woman in control. Cade is a former MMA champion and single dad to a beautiful and smart 3 year old. Scarlett never had plans of becoming a mom but now that she’s pregnant her life is changing. Will she give herself a chance at love and happiness with Caden? Will Caden accept Scarlett’s bossing him around? Hold on tight! This is one heck of a ride!

I love when the main characters are both alphas, Scarlett doesn’t give away control. Caden doesn’t take orders from anyone… these two are the perfect pull and push. Their relationship is explosive. I think this is the hottest book Bella has written to date and I absolutely love it!
Scarlett’s journey to becoming even stronger, was amazing! Seeing her letting go and trusting Cade. Priceless! And Cade, what a man! The best dad, business man, friend and partner ever. Cade St. James is what dreams are made of, but yet again I think this is what I say after reading every single book by Bella. She’s just a master at creating swoony, strong and lovable men.

This book is amazing, I can’t wait to read the next installment in the Restless Kings Series 💚

The most amazing love tale: Hope Hays and Jordan Delaney.
Hope is a divorcée, science teacher that’s just going through the motions. Jordan is a political advisor in DC who’s trying to lay low after something worth of a scandal happened in the country’s capital, so he decides to go back home for a while.
Hope is trying to get back in the dating game after two years of being divorced, so saying that her flirting is awkward and funny is an understatement 😅 it doesn’t help that Jordan is there to see it all and Hope really feels bad.
What starts as an awkward attempt of flirting, ends up being a beautiful love story between two souls that we’re looking for a new “home”.
I love, love, love this book! So much! I love how Hope is so into science that when she gets nervous she just starts talking about chemical reactions and what not 😅 Jordan on the other hand is well articulated and tries really hard not to fall for the beautiful red her and her two adorable girls but not even a strong man like himself stand a chance against the power of true love.
It doesn’t matter what happens, and why he’s hiding in their little town of Riviera View, they are meant to be together and will find their way to forever.

Delicious banter: Luke Kim and Nora Rossi. A billionaire in a small town in New England meets an alpha wolf as he calls her 😍 there are some many things to love about this book. It hit me at a personal level on so many things, I struggled keeping my tears at bay. Luke’s story is absolutely amazing! How being hardworking pays off but it’s not everything at the end of the day. You always have to make time for love.
And Nora, behind that strong façade is a woman that has been judged and hurt not only by men and “friends” but also by her own family. She decides to show them who’s boss and becomes one heck of a bada$$ b*tch boss! Goals!
These two have an enemies to lovers story that packs some heat! The way he gives himself to her, there’s power in knowing the other person is your equal, your teammate. And how Nora decides to take a step back and does some needed self growth in order to be the best version of herself. All this is possible thanks to her coven. This group of women is goals!
I absolutely loved them and cannot wait to read the next book in the series!

Such a strong, beautiful love: Jud Lawson owns a motorcycle shop. He’s out and about when a storm pours down and he finds her, Salem. He helps her out and there’s an instant connection. She’s an enchantress, pure black magic that traps his heart.
He needs someone to take care of managing his office and Salem needs a job, so they start to spend lots of time together. They fight off their attraction every single time they’re in the same room but no matter what, their chemistry is off the roof!
Their ride is raw and frantic and has so much angst! Get ready! I cried, laughed and swooned! The amount of feelings I had left to work through after reading this book were crazy but it was a great read nonetheless.

Twisted beyond belief: I’m not going to go into detail as I usually do. This book has so many red flags, so much cheating, so many trigger warnings. It’s so morally wrong! Yet, I couldn’t put it down. I ate it all up. No, I didn’t particularly liked any of the characters but the story was so twisted, I just had to know how was it going to end.
I’m going to let you do the judging, all I’m going to say is that this book messed up with my mind and was enjoyable AF!

This series keeps getting better and better: Colton Westbrook it’s on his way to his brothers wedding in Mexico, one bad storm leaves him grounded in Miami and instead of going to a hotel he spends the night getting to know her, Winnie. They have 13 hours before their plane departs so they do some speed dates. It was awesome! From dance off, to Netflix these two got to see parts of each other they had never shared with anyone before.
Fast forward one year and they never saw each other again after the flight, Winnie decided it wasn’t worth it to keep in touch with a billionaire who had given her a fake name.
Her life has a 180° turn and when she’s at her lowest, exhausted and without anyone to lean on, Colton shows up determined she’s his forever. She won’t give in easily but their story is amazing!

The Westbrook boys love hard and once Colton made up his mind, he made it his mission in life to make Winnie his. I love how protective Colton is, the entire family rallied around them to defend them from all the hardships Winnie was dealing with. Winnie is a strong and smart woman who had been burned over and over again, so trust didn’t come easy for her. Colton showed her it was ok to trust him. LOVE!
I know I say this every time I read a new book by Avery, but this one is my favorite. The stories keep getting better and better, there’s just so much love!
And now I can’t wait for Ashton’s story, he needs an epic ending ❤️

Devon and Leah May are amazing: This is book two in the series. Devon had a very hard childhood, his stepfather was mean and did things to Devon no child should be put through. Devon swears to make his stepdad pay for all the hurt he has inflicted once he’s old enough.
He’s in his early twenties now and life is good, he takes his job seriously and one night at the club he has to help a girl, Jodie after someone tried to take advantage of her. When he drops Jodie off he meets her, Leah May, and his world gets upside down.

Leah May believes she’s The Raven, the perfect match for The Reaper and as they start to spend more time together is evident the connection these two share was written in the stars.

This book is so amazing, it’s hard for me to come up with the words as to describe why. There’s so much darkness but also so much love! Nikki was able to create a book full of dichotomies yet blended them beautifully in an all consuming story. I’m in love with their love, how it blooms despite all of their obstacles. It’s just perfect! I can’t wait for book 3 in the series.

So much pain: This is the story of Harley Cobreski, another member of the Cerberus MC club. His life was rough as a child until his mom met Micah Cobreski (a member of the club) and he became his dad. Harley grew up to be an amazing man and met his forever, Laila. They got married and had a beautiful baby girl, sadly Laila passed away in a car accident. Harley is devastated and in deep depression and thankfully the club is there to help him and his daughter out. The club has a daycare where Harley takes his daughter and there he meets Alyssa, the new babysitter.
He instantly develops strong feelings for her, but he’s still depressed so he pours all the anger and pain at her. They end up having a love/hate relationship until he’s able to deal with his feelings and gets his head out of his a**

I’ve been waiting for this book since I ever read about Harley in Micah’s book. I wasn’t expecting so much pain for Harley, but I guess not everything can be rainbows and roses and I was happy to see him and Aly being able to get a HEA.

Slowest burn ever! But so worth it: This book… I don’t even know how to start. At first I was so excited because hello, I love me a hot and broody soccer player but then, wait there’s way more to it than an athlete and a princess… these two banter like no other, they truly hate each other, or so they think 😏 then the book begins to develop all of these royal secrets and the stakes get higher and higher, the more you read the more secrets you discover, until everything comes down like an avalanche and you’re mind is blown! Once all cards are laid out there’s nothing else than Rowan and Juliana, and I’m here for it!!! This is probably the SLOWEST BURN I’ve ever read and I’d be lying if I didn’t say that I absolutely loved it. Their relationship goes from enemies, I can’t stand you, I’d kill you if I could to lovers, I can’t imagine my life without you and the in between is absolute perfection!
This book grew on me as I read along and understood all that was going on. It was a very worthy ride! Now I gotta find time to read book one in the series and I cannot wait for more in this world 😍

Swoon for days: Holden Sanders, keeper extraordinaire of the San Francisco Strickers is on a two year self imposed dating ban after a very public and humiliating breakup. He’s off the pitch for a while after a major concussion so he decides to spend time with his niece and takes her to the library, then he meets the hottest librarian ever, Molly.
These two have so much in common, it’s easy to see why they fall for each other despite his grumpy attitude and her sunshine ways.
I love how much details we get from their perspectives, all their feelings and how open they are to talk about them. I also love how much of the actual game we get, not just a mention of the sport.
I truly enjoyed their banter and their hot scenes, it was a fun book to read and I can’t wait for more in the series.

Hockey love: Silas has been pining on Phoebe for almost a year now. He’s a hot as sin hockey player, she’s a plus size girl that works with an athletic clothing company. He’s a huge flirt and doesn’t hide his feelings towards Phoebe, she doesn’t believe he’s being serious and dismisses him every single time.
Silas is as patient as they come and keeps trying to make Phoebe see that he’s serious about her but Phoebe has been burned in the past. Will they be able to find their HEA?
Silas, bless his heart, he knew from the get go that Phoebe was it for him. Maybe he went in too hard but he was honest the entire time. I saw where Phoebe was coming from, being hurt in the past but it wasn’t Silas’ fault and he was the one paying for it.
I say this time and time again, when a main character messes up big time I expect them to grovel and Phoebe delivered! I love how she was able to face her demons and work on herself so she could be worthy of Silas’ love.

Kelly found her home: Brett works at a garage and is a very talented mechanic. Kelly is Charley’s best friend (the owner’s wife) and has been in and out of town for the last while. Brett and Kelly hook up every time she’s in town but the last time they did Brett thought Kelly would stay for good, then she left to pursue her photography gig.
She’s back in town and looks broken, Brett swore to stay away. It hurts too much though… but their chemistry is so strong! They can’t stay away from each other. Will it be enough for them to get a HEA?
This is book 3 in the series and it can be read as a stand-alone. It was refreshing to see it was Brett the one hurting and not the girl. He was way into her and although she was too, her past was stopping her from going all in. I love the friend group, it’s an amazing and hilarious family! Theo is so smart and funny (Stefano and Gabby’s son, book 2)! I also love that their happy ever after was their own, it wasn’t traditional but it was perfect for them.

Enemies to lovers!: Amelia is a therapist who specializes in couples, Ethan is a lawyer who specializes in divorces. Their offices are next to each other’s, see the problem? Yeah! There’s a problem… these two have so much chemistry! It’s insane. Their sparring is unmatched. Ethan acts like a school boy around Amelia, making pranks and trying to avoid the undeniable… they belong together.
Their journey is full of angst, pranks, push and pull, and underneath all that there’s love and fear. They both have been burned in the past and are afraid to give themselves fully. Ethan is a single dad and hence super protective of his son, Oliver! The cutest boy ever.
Amelia has the girls (her amazing group of friends) backing her up and the laughs and fun are at spades in this book.

Be prepared to swoon, laugh and get all hot and bothered with these two! It’s definitely another gem by Harlow!

Love and fantastic and amazing!: Knox Ramsey belongs to one of the most powerful families in Kauai, he loves living in paradise and doesn’t want to follow his family’s tradition, to marry someone from one of the other founding families. One night he sees her, the Angel of fire, Cassidy. These two have an instant connection. It’s insta lust and insta love, all at once. He’ll defy his family for her, he’ll die for her. Their connection is so intense, it almost feel out of this world. They’ll fight hard to have their HEA.

I loved this book from the get go. I love that it’s a fantasy world, without being precisely fantasy. The description of the island is beautiful, the lush tropical setting. The patches of fruits, the natural pools. I wish I could go to their little haven. Their insta lust is also pretty spectacular, they were at it for about a month after they met and wow! it was intense. But I mean, if I was with a tan, muscular and completely obsessed with me man, I wouldn’t complain one bit 😅
There was some mystery surrounding Cassidy but it was easy to figure out (to me), once all was said and done it was a very light read, perfect for summer and I can’t wait for more on this amazing world.

Jackson St. James is what dreams are made of: Jackson St. James and Marlow Marché have been friends for years and lately they’ve added “benefits” to their friendship. It’s New Years Eve and Jackson wants to celebrate with Marlow, he wants more but he’s not sure she wants the same. Marlow is a beautiful woman, always dressed with the latest fashion trends and designer handbags and shoes. What no one knows is the amount of issues she’s dealing with, her dad left her alone financially and her job doesn’t pay enough to cover her expenses. There’s so much in her mind, yet Jackson is always there. Reminding her how good they are together, showing her she can trust him.
This book is full of love, Jackson’s love. This man will move heaven and earth to show Marlow she’s the one for him, he’s amazing like that. I truly enjoyed their banter, their spice, the group of friends is fantastic as well. The only thing I didn’t love was Marlow 😅 but all in all it was a nice read and a good addition to the series. Again, Jackson St. James is out of this world amazing and if you love swoony heroes this book is for you.

Age gap perfection: Matteo Rossi is a 40 something single dad and restaurant owner who doesn’t have time for himself. Eliza is a nurse in her late twenties tired of casual and trying to find her place in the world. Matteo’s daughter, Valentina, is a bright and smart girl who suffers from asma and after a bad episode, Matteo takes her to the hospital and there they meet Eliza. There’s attraction and eventually they figure out their connection goes beyond the chemistry, there’s only one issue, Matteo is scared of making time for himself to enjoy life… and Eliza is a super strong heroine who won’t take sloppy seconds. YAS Queen!
I’ll be honest, I loved this book! I kept messaging Daphne telling her how much I was laughing, how accurate she described New England in the last tail of winter… it goes on forever 😅 and I know I truly loved this book because the characters made me feel what they were feeling at the moment. I was so upset at how Matteo behaved, Eliza compromised many things to be with him, yet he kept backpedaling and misleading her. Until enough was enough and it took some major groveling on his part to get to their HEA. These two are perfect together. Loved, loved, loved it!

So much love!: Andrea Delarosa is the new Don, his family was attacked and although he was never meant to rule he’s in charge now. His sister married the boss of the Irish mob and is living her best life, if only he could do the same. But the past has a way to weigh you down and Andrea can’t seem to let go.
Claire McGowan is Darragh’s cousin (Andrea’s sister husband) and she came to America from France so she could get the best doctors. Claire is 7 years younger than Andrea and he’s a bad man, a mafia boss, whereas she’s sunshine and rainbows personified. You’d never guess that she has so much going on in her life. They shouldn’t make sense together but deep down they understand each other only like true soulmates do. She’s the calm he needs, he’s the anchor she craves. They work together in perfect sync. They love hard, they don’t need a label nor words to know what they have is real and they’ll go to the end of the world for each other. If that’s not love, I don’t know what it is.

In true Mallory Hart fashion, it was a story of broken but beautiful people and I wouldn’t change a thing of Andrea and Claire’s journey.

Also, major kudos for giving us a little peak into Darragh and Pina’s life.

Love and Resilience: Beckett Easton is back in Wolf Gap, he’s a doctor and has been all around the world but now he feels is time to be back home and settle down. While his house is being built he becomes Addie’s roommate (she’s the cousin of Beckett’s brother fiancé, Everly) and she’s finally getting to be free after living under precarious circumstances with her father.
Addie is timid, and guarded but full of life and wonder. Beckett is strong and protective. Could these two find their way to forever?
Oh my goodness! What a book! If I thought I had swoon with Hayes (book 1) and Calder (book 2), I wasn’t definitely prepared for the absolute man that is Beckett Easton 😍
What starts as a true friendship full of firsts for Addie (first time having pizza, coke cherry, Chinese food, learning to drive), ends up being such an epic love story full of heart warming moments and closure for their pasts.
I’m in love with Beckett, yes! New book boyfriend and all that but Addie, she’s the star in this book. You wouldn’t think she had the spunk in her to become her own person and overcome all of the obstacles life has grown at her but she sure does and her strength and resilience are major turn ons for Beckett.
This couple is absolute perfection, they complement each other so well. They see each other for who they really are and help each other to achieve their goals, overcome their fears and deal with the demons from their pasts that threaten to deny them from a HEA.
I really don’t want to spoil the book, you all need to read it and fall in love with these two like I did.

Flawless is Perfection: Rhett Eaton is one of the best bull riders out there, cocky beyond measure and hot as sin in a rough, untamed way.
Summer Hamilton is a lawyer and the newest addition to Rhett’s PR team. She’s tasked with becoming Rhett’s “babysitter” for the next two months since he just made very upset some of his sponsors with some scandalous statements… Rhett doesn’t like milk! How dare he 😅
Let me begin by saying that this is the first book I read by Elise and I’m beyond impressed. I loved every single thing about this book! From their banter, her sassiness, his cockiness, the dirty talk, the funny bits. I enjoyed it all! I went from laughing to swooning to crying. Loved, loved, loved it! Even the little angst was so good and had me rooting even harder for Summer! She’s so strong and no one messes with her!
Can we go back to the spice? Because oh my! Rhett Eaton is a manly man with a big and filthy mouth and im here for it! Phew I always liked cowboys in romance books but this is just another level of awesomeness!
This series is off to a great start and I couldn’t be more thankful to be part of Elsie’s advance readers. Thank you so much for allowing me to experience this outstanding book ahead of time.

Best friends to lovers ever: Arran Adair is the second to last of the Adair siblings and the black sheep, the failure (or so he thinks). He’s been away from Scotland for a long time and after he’s losing his north, Brodan (his closest brother) decides that Arran needs and intervention and convinces him to move back to Scotland. Fast forward to present time and Arran has found his footing and is thriving! Mostly thanks to Eredine, the gorgeous and mysterious Pilates instructor from Lachlan’s estate (Lachlan is the oldest Adair sibling). Arran and Ery develop an amazing friendship, their run every morning together and Arran has been pining for Ery for a while, the only problem? Brodan has had an interest in Eredine as well. Oh boy, here we go!

Oh you sweet and amazing, Arran! I love how hard he falls for Ery. He’s an Adair, so he’s a possessive Scottish man that won’t stop at anything to get what he wants, which includes Eredine. I love how their relationship develops from friends to lovers to HEA. Of course, nothing is easy, so they’ll go through some pain and some dark secrets before they can reach their HEA. Oh!!! And please let’s not think that Eredine is an American just hiding in the beautiful Scottish highlands. This woman means business and she won’t allow anyone to think she’s weak and can’t take care of herself! Gave me Robyn Penalighon and Jocelyne Carmichael vibes (from other Samantha’s books). A total BIC!
Another five stars, outstanding book by Samantha! Amazing!

history: B07VXN96WP B07PWTSMZC B07RBWCKV1 B07V7JKBXJ B08F6DJ5B9 B08CBWRVXB B08S74L14S
review:
Amazing read!: Well I never. I don’t know where to start, as this author has done a phenomenal job with this book. I loved it!
With dark little twists and turns throughout, I was enjoying it the whole way through. Clara and Jonathon share a special connection and with that, I could feel the strength of their bond through the pages.
Little Dolls is not for the faint hearted, there are topics that may not be for everyone, but in saying that it was well written, very enjoyable and I can’t wait for book two.

An angst filled emotional start to a phenomenal series!: What. A. Debut. Novel.

Wow. I can only think of one other time I have said that in the years I have been a reader. Seriously, just wow!

The very first page utterly sucked me in. Elizabeth’s writing is the type you effortlessly fall into and will keep you wanting to be there the entire time. I promise you I sat down to start, looked up, and was already at 64% in the book. Just. Like. That. I had the most challenging time putting this book down to jump back into real life!

Whit is living two lives - a rock god and a father. Rushing home from shows to be with Lily has changed his life for the better, although some would argue that. He is a fantastic father, and I loved how he prioritizes Lily! On the other hand, Ava couldn’t be in a more different part of life than Whit. She is surviving the days by working and keeping her head above water. But something shifts in the universe when Whit and Ava decide to take a night for themselves. Let me tell you; their chemistry is palpable!

What happens next couldn’t be more unexpected. This novel is filled with drama, angst, steam, and an underlying current of hope. Plus, it’s filled with plot twists that will leave you on the edge of your seat. I laughed, cried, swooned, and wanted to break something while reading! I can tell you this is a story I will be reading again, no doubt about it.

Unexpected is standalone in a series! Woohoo. Insert happy dance. I can’t wait for the next set of characters and their journey!

history: B07KQFL9Z1 B07LG8LK56 B07YCQPTBW B087FGYZLT B08GVJ6HCY B08KQXPP72
review: Great New Series Starter: As always with this author, you cannot go wrong by reading one of her books. This is Book 1 of a new series, Fast & Fury, though I suspect we'll see cameos from some fan favorites, as this author tends to give the readers little sneak peeks across her entire literary universe. When female lead character, Bronte, takes a new job at a motorcycle shop, she's desperate to start her life fresh and new. But Crow, her new boss, isn't going to make it easy on her. Bronte and Crow clash from the very beginning, but who doesn't love a whole lot of angst and pushback with their romance? I know I do! And this one does not disappoint in either department. There are little twists and turns around a lot of corners with this one, and I can't wait to see where the author will take the rest of the series.
Just what we wanted!: Perfect addition to the stocking!
Really Irish feeling: Well written and entertaining

Great book for detail of what things were like back then: I enjoyed the detail and descriptions of the teams and especially of the descriptions of Walter Johnson at the different stages of his career.
Laborious reading.: Mystery was a bit thin.
A bit laborious: Very detailed and boring at times

history: B0092PPR5M B00IKOTY6Y 097990353X B010J98W8I 1987942043 0998229601 B00OGWASCS B0151YQUIK B08KY6VZ1K
review: Not for faint of heart but excellent read.: The subject matter is child abduction and all the darkness that goes with that. I found it engrossing and well written. Held my interest all the way through. The abuse was handled delicately. You were aware but it did not get detailed except for the psychological effects which I enjoyed. Maybe the child was written wiser than is realistic but abused children often have an uncanny second sense about what to do in life threatening situations.

Easy, quick and delicious: Over the past 2 years, forced by the pandemic, I have been doing far more home cooking than I had ever wanted to. So many recipes (mainly NY Times Cooking) have called for so many ingredients it wasn't practical or expedient to use the recipes. Melissa Clark's Pantry dishes mainly fulfilled my needs and now comes another NY Times Cooking writer who does it at least as well. Not to say one need go back to pandemic eating, but to have a cookbook on hand that has practical recipes for everyday cooking that doesn't call for an excess of ingredients or time required or difficult to find, most of which one usually has on hand. I have made a number of her recipes so far in the brief time I've owned this book and not a dud yet. I can easily see myself cooking right through this book. Very satisfied.

A page turner!: If you enjoy the Teddy Fay novels, this would be a great addition to your reading list.  I like the way the characters build from one book to another.  It's almost like they are your family.

Interesting back round info on Queen Mum.: I liked the book since there's a lot of historical information.  I'm not sure in reality if the Queen was as obsessed with her secrets as we are lead to believe in this book, but agree if they did come out, there would have been some royal fallout!

history: B005FH2HC2 B006LSZECO B0089LOJ0Y 1612383734 1612387500 B004JF4MME B07GNTW4X5 B07V9F9DQD
review: Could not put it down!: An unusual story about 3 brothers married to 3 women that wear a veils nearly always, and don’t know which brother is their husband.  It’s an amazing tale that keeps you reading until the end.  You’ll wish there was more.

A beautiful story within a story: This is a beautiful and poignant story within a story about family, mothers and daughters, sorrow and love spanning two generations - one in contemporary time and one in Leningrad just before and during WW II.  I never knew about the WW II Siege of Leningrad and it’s impact on ordinary people prior to reading this book - Have a box of tissues ready and be prepared for tears and heart warming smiles which this story is sure to evoke.

Fantastic final suspense thriller in the Jorja Rose series: A fantastic wrap up of this series.  Honestly, I believe that I met my cardiovascular workout points for the week as I read Jorja’s adventures - I was so immersed in the story and flipping pages so quickly as I imagined myself right with her as she ran for her life through the streets, fought criminals and performed more amazing art heists!! I have really enjoyed her character and in this book could really see how (even with her doubts!) she has grown stronger  in her relationship with God; it really has been a treat to see how this author describes the human spiritual struggle without prositylizing. It allows room for the reader to ponder and consider how they feel/believe.  Jorja has had an amazing life and is a very talented woman - she’s the best international art thief!  When I think of the greedy and self-centered thief’s she has worked with (often by force and manipulation) she really shines bright in that she has not turned to the darkside. I’m quite satisfied with the ending and highly recommend this book!

Leaves out important issues: This book was kind of interesting, but very limited.  It gives a brief history of cults and how they have used language and other techniques to control their followers.  Sadly, I was disappointed that the author said nothing about the current language controversies in the social justice movement.  That would be a gold mine of language modification.
I loved the series.: The story held my interest so much I hated to put it down.
WOW!!! What a story!: I loved this book.  Maybe my favorite yet.  Really made me stop and think of the possibilities of cyber-terrorism.  Keeps you guessing to the very list page!

This Book is Excellent: Really well written book. Easy to understand with lots of sources. This explains almost everything about this plandemic. Thank you Dr. Mercola for being brave enough to speak the truth.

Beautifully written: Loved it! The way Garber brings her characters to life from words on a page is beautiful. From her descriptions, I can see everything in my mind! I’m so excited to see where the story goes from here!
Mesmerizing!: Absolutely breathtaking! Excellent world building, relatable characters, and that ending!!!

One of the Best Gifts Ever: My son saw this, grabbed it, worked on it all day to give to his Dad that night. My husband and I were in stitches reading what he wrote and seeing his sketches! Priceless! One of the best gifts ever, and extremely well made/high quality and durable paper and binding with lovely color prints throughout.

Perfect for 2nd and 3rd graders: Beautiful book! Perfect for teaching my second and third graders the Pantheon and some basic Greek Mythology. I compared this to about 4 other similar books and found this one most helpful for that age range.

RUN and buy every Colleen Hoover book. Immediately!!: Love everything Colleen does. I hope she writes forever because I don’t ever want to be without one of her books. Her stories break your heart and then put it back together. Can’t get enough.
Foraging in the Ozarks: Interesting book. Gave lots of information. Just wish there were more recipes on how to use these foods.
Finn and Parker: I loved reading Finn and Parker's story.  This was my first story to read in the series and I am definitely going back to read the first books.
Heartbreaking with HEA: This story hurts your heart. You can feel the hurt and the pain, but it is worth it when they get their happily ever after.
Better and Better: I'm loving this series. Each book keeps getting better and better.

*Chef Kiss*: This was my first read for Charlie Nottingham. She had been doing one-liners on TikTok for a while and I was invested in this book from the first post.
And by everything, this book hit its mark in so many ways.
She did amazing with the poly relationship dynamics and acknowledged that it's not this, magical thing and everyone is happy all the time. It's communication and boundaries. You know she did the research and talked to real people and it shows.
She killed it with the twists and turns, every page, every new chapter I needed more and more. I wanted to know what was going to happen next with the Woman in Black.
And when I tell you the spice, was on fire and I simped hard, so hard for Ezra, the little cinnamon roll man.
So recap,
Hot men,
Fantastic plot Line
Awesome writing
You can't read just one: I've read the entire  collection.  My sister and mother in law have read the series. How soon is the next one coming out? I'll be reading that one too.
Get them all: Following these characters from book one to the latest.  Next one  is not out till next year and I am ready to reserve. Sister and mother-in-law also love these stories.
Gory Horror: Unique idea brings non-stop gory horror!

Unsettling: Even though this book is almost 20 years old, it's relatable.  Reading how "The Store" affects the town makes sense with the world today with Wal-Mart and Amazon, with a supernatural twist.

Out of the gate, non stop horror: I made the grave mistake of reading this book while my husband was traveling for work. I had to sleep with the lights on until he came back. Typical horror and ghost fiction books have a slow build with a few shocks here and there, then finally get good the last 50 pages. Not this book. Blackwell has you hooked in the prologue. There were parts of this book that I had to stop reading because of how scared I was getting. This is hands-down, one of the BEST books I've read.

A note to Blackwell-PLEASE write more!!!

A Glimpse into Golf's Magical Past: This book caught my eye years ago and I purchased it, read it once and gave it to a friend of mine. Still, I recall scenes from the book from time to time. I especially liked how the author was able to present the Lincoln Park Golf Course so accurately. I've played there many times on foggy days like the book portrays. The characterisations of Ben Hogan and company are entertaining and I believe historically accurate. Similar to the Kinsella book Field of Dreams, there are lessons learned from the books unrelated to golf. Well worth the read.

Nor Just Another Cookbook: I ordered this cookbook back in April and I'm so glad I finally have it.  I can't wait to try so many of the recipes--she has a whole section on weeknight soups, meatballs, chicken . . . just wonderful.  And we love to treat ourselves on weekends--recipes for scones, popovers and old-fashioned crumb cake are already on our list.  A wonderful cookbook that distinguishes itself by both usefulness and quality of recipes.  Thank you Jenn!

One of the best standalone YA: After an invite from a childhood friend takes Adrijana to court, her life is flipped upside down after a seemingly simple question. Being new to the court, Adrijana becomes the obvious suspect in a series of deaths. How can she prove her innocence? Aligning with a royal Mesmer, she sets out to unravel the mysterious deaths and ultimate plot to destabilize the only home she’s ever known. What will it take to unravel the truth and protect those dearest to her?
This young adult fantasy mystery will draw you in immediately. Having never read anything by this author, something was intriguing about the short synopsis that first drew me to this book. As with any new-to-me author, I was skeptical but I’m so relieved to find that this book was one of the best YA fantasy books I’ve ever read.
The flow of storytelling is so incredibly polished that the reader becomes immersed in the world of Adrjssia from the first page. Claire Luana does an eloquent job of setting the tone and atmosphere of this new world without drowning the reader in minute details. This story could have easily been drawn out into multiple books but it works perfectly as a stand-alone tale. I am a reader who typically tries to figure out the mystery before the narrator does. However, this was not the case in this book. The reading was easy enough to follow along while gripping to keep me drawn to the moment instead of jumping ahead. There’s an expertly practiced balance between the mystery, depth of the characters, and seductiveness of journeying with Adrijana.
Overall, this book deserves nothing less than five stars.

A woven tale of romance and mystery: Every article of clothing has a story, though many of us will never know the truth in the threads. For Tess, however, she begins to experience the history of a dress and the original owner’s final moments. Those feelings become amplified from the first moment she lays eyes on Trey. Will they be able to uncover the century-old mystery? Is what they’re experiencing truly their feelings or just a shadow of ghostly desires?

Author Sandra L. Young weaves a fantastic tale of romance and mystery among the threads of history and murder. From the get-go, I was drawn into the balance among the various characters: Tess’ whimsical but fiercely independent nature contrasted with Trey’s calculated and calm demeanor. The varying levels of paranormal belief, how their backgrounds play a part in their present interactions, and how they develop as individuals and together all build an intriguing tale. It was a delightful addition for me as a seamstress and lover of vintage clothing to have this story be so strongly tied to specific period pieces.

For everything I liked about this book, minor stumbling blocks brought the overall rating down. For example, occasionally the author would take a clear stance on a particular “hot topic” (eg. homelessness). While I did appreciate the tie-in to the overall story, the initial appearance was abrupt and felt out of place.

Overall, I would recommend this book to anyone who enjoys a romantic tale and those who want a first read into a book regarding ghostly encounters.

A very turbulent flight!: This debut book kept me turning the pages until the very end. The atmosphere in the airplane rang true due to the writer having been a flight attendant on two major airlines. I am an avid traveler so this book grabbed my attention and increased my respect for the job that is entrusted to a crew. A few criticisms: the dialog between the pilot and his wife are a little "sappy"; the scene at Yankee Stadium was far fetched. But these are minor points considering the reading pleasure this book brought me.

Good start dissolving into nonsense: The premise of only two black women forming a relationship in an otherwise white publishing company had the beginning of an intriguing story. However, toward the end of the book, the story line became so unbelievable that I thought I suddenly was reading the ending of another book. I hate to rain on a debut book but I would not waste the time on this novel.

Great stories from a great storyteller.: If you've enjoyed the Tales from Lake Woebegon over the years, you'll like this book.  Keillor reminds us of some of the stories he's  told, and I've laughed all over again.

Fun ideas for my family and entertaining!: Sandy has a special way with food and hospitality, and this book feels like a natural extension of her creativity. Our family makes some kind of food board at least once a week, so I'm looking forward to trying many of these recipes. And the photos are beautiful - I love that every board/recipe has a photo!

THIS IS A MUST!: If you are a canner.....or just want to dabble in canning- this is an MUST! This book is my absolute favorite for canning small batches. I have made almost everything in this book and loved them all! Her canning recipes follow the season which is wonderful and she includes great recipes for dishes that include what you have canned. I cannot recommend this book enough and have gifted it to quite a few people.

Deeply Moving: The characters in these fourteen stories haunted me long after I read the book. In lyrical, haunting prose, Rohan writes about their loneliness and their struggle, and moments of grace. Such stories are more vital than ever in this time of alienation and distance.

I cannot understand the good reviews!: The book has practically no substantive content.  I cannot at all understand the good reviews as this book wouldn't even be enough for a two year old.  It is nicely made and okay pictures but content is completely lacking.  I do not at all recommend this book for the purpose for which it is supposed to serve.

What happened to Ichabod?: As a reader fascinated by The Legend of Sleepy Hollow since childhood, I’m enticed by any writing related to the subject. This is the most compelling and satisfying of all I’ve read. Smart, romantic, spooky, heartbreaking and hopeful…this was a thoroughly engrossing and enjoyable read.

Actual images from show!: Soo many times it’s difficult to find the right calendar for Supernatural. But these guys did a great job as it actually shows images from the show. Will but there’s next year too.

What a gem we have in this one !!!!!: I love love love it . An amazing story about a woman with fertility issues who just want to have a baby to love and cherish . But for that to happen she must find the man who will be her sperm donor . The only man she has on her mind is Josh her first love and her briother best friend . At first he is negative but after while he agrees and then their journey starts . A story about love , friendship , accepting who you truly are . I loved the group of the women and how real they were .
The author made me laugh and cry from the first to last page .
I am hoping for more Josh and Gemma story to be told ., I want a sequel .
I received this book from net galley and the publisher as an ARC. Thank you! All thoughts and opinions are my own.

For the lovers of dogs: One more amazing story from the author . She is the maid of honor at her best friend wedding and he is the best man to his brother wedding . Together they have to prepare a wedding in two weeks . She has a crush on him and she is worried that he will not want anything more than a friendship . He is the man who does not do relathionships because if he doesn 't feel he always leave first . He is looking to feel like his parents did and anything less is not acceptable . With her he is sure that he found his other half . A cute boxer is bossing them together .

I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

Great story: This is the first book I have read from the author and I have to say I loved it . She is the daughter of a inventor and she decide to stop being a wallflower and became a Incomparable and help other young ladies . But first she must stop having dreams about Devon a second sin of a Duke . He is not like the other Lords who spent the money they have inherit from their family . He wants to accomplice everything with money he earns and so he has to find a sum of money to buy a coffeeshop . He tries to make coffee taste better so he has been helping her father at his workshop . Thanks to a letter she gave him he wants to change for the best . While they spend time together sparks fly all over the place . When her father catch them kissing he force them to marry . He wants to marry her and give her the life she deserve but with no money off his own he can not have her and the coffeeshop . What will he do ? Will love or his pride win ?

I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

OK: She is a Duke sister and he is his best friend and partner . They both feel attractive to the other but have their worries . Will they let the others determine their relationship ?.

I received a free copy of this book and am voluntarily leaving a review.

Starting over: A sweet and funny read . She just got fired and will spend her summer taking care her sisters kids while she and her husband had to travel abroad for their jobs . While spenting time with the kids she deside to built a treehouse in the back yard . The neighbor is a very handsome man and they soon start to date . But at the end of the summer she will leave so she can find a new job . Will she stay and be with him or will she leave to chase her dream ?
I received this book from net galley and the publisher as an ARC. Thank you! All thoughts and opinions are my own

Greece is the best destination: I am Greek and the way the author talk about is very authentic . You can feel the love for my country and Crete . I loved that our heroine while she had a life in England she decide to live everything back and start a new life in a foreng coyntry . She starts this journey with her fiance but he after a while does not want to live in Greece and they split . But now she is not alone she has her new friends and all the villagers . But there is a new man who will make her move on . When she goes back to England her ex is waiting for her . Who will she choose ?
The only thing I did not like is that the name for Darius or Apollo are Ancient Greek but they are not very used nowdays and especially in Crete .
I received this book from net galley and the publisher as an ARC. Thank you! All thoughts and opinions are my own

Lethal Cover-Up by Darlene L. Turner: Lethal Cover-Up is Darlene's 3rd book in her Border Patrol Series, it is also a stand alone novel. I very much enjoyed Darlene's first 2 books in the series, but I loved Lethal Cover-Up! Darlene's writing just keeps getting better! I know that's a bit cliché, but it really is true!!

Lethal Cover-Up is Madison's and Tucker's story. They were high school sweethearts and are now investigating Madison's sister's death. I loved this story! There were twists, secrets, excitement, adventure and I loved that it's faith based. In Lethal Cover-Up both Madison and Tucker need to learn trust, to trust in God and each other. I always take away something from Darlene's story, in this novel it's trust.

And have you seen the cover?!! It's my favorite!! I love fall, leaves covering the ground and sidewalks, pumpkins and clean crisp air. I can't recommend Darlene L. Turner's books enough, I promise you, you're going to love it!!! BTW... my "who done it guess", was wrong!! Love it!!

review: Fantastic storyline and writing: Just enough suspense to  entertain but not keep me up at night.  I fell in love with the characters and hope there is another book coming.
a favorite book: One of my favorite books ever. I reread it every couple of years. Well written. You feel the characters emotions and they touch your own.

The Real World and Fiction: Silva has crafted a novel that incorporates contemporary events in a brilliant manner. The one shortcoming I experienced was the incomplete discussion of how money laundering works (Russian rubles somehow becoming U. S. dollars is not explained well).  Predictably, many reviewers here are upset with the clear denunciation of Donald Trump and with the support for anti-virus measures; I on the other hand found those informative and useful in advancing the story. I note that Allon has both aged and been seriously wounded, and I wonder if this last in the series about him. If so, I will miss him and the engaging stories about him.

Personal Biases: Mr. Blox: I just completed Breaking Point.

Authors frequently express their personal beliefs in their novels. Whatever may be your issues with federal government agencies what you write in this book is excessive. It is unfortunate that your wife, your daughters, and your editors did not tell you that you went over the top with this litany about federal authorities.

You don’t care about one reader. Nonetheless I want you to know I am no longer a fan.

A focused primer on researched-backed teaching methods.: I've read a LOT of educational literature, but few have ever presented SPECIFIC teaching strategies in such a clear and concise way. Dr. Agarwal is great about offering free resources on her website, but you want this book if you want to dig deeper. I adjusted my teaching practice just halfway through the book because of the Mrs. Bain's "Retrieval Guides" - brilliant stuff! I could go on and on; I'm a 20-year teacher and I still have so much to learn, but "Powerful Teaching" definitely pushed my thinking forward.

Horror thriller pays off: Another great Pendergast thriller with a sci-fi twist.  Interesting developments with Constance and our intrepid FBI agent solves a horrific case. I look forward to the next in the series.

Excellent Story: Once again, David creates a story which is impossible to put down until you reach the final page. Can’t wait to read the next in the series.
Loved It: More twists and turns in this novel then a roller coaster at Six Flags amusement park. Can’t wait to start the next book in the series.
